description: Add missing language toolchains to Dockerfile: FreeBASIC, CoffeeScript, and Sed

userStories.title: Add CoffeeScript to Dockerfile
userStories.description: As a developer, I want CoffeeScript installed in Docker so the CoffeeScript Sudoku solver can run.
acceptanceCriteria: Add 'npm install -g coffeescript' to the Node.js section (section 3) in server/Dockerfile
Place it after 'npm install -g typescript ts-node tsx@latest'
The coffee command will be available globally in the container
Dockerfile syntax is valid (no build errors from this change)

userStories.title: Add Sed to system dependencies
userStories.description: As a developer, I want Sed explicitly installed in Docker for the Sed Sudoku solver.
acceptanceCriteria: Add 'sed' to the SYSTEM DEPENDENCIES apt-get install list in server/Dockerfile
Place it alphabetically or near other text processing tools (bc, dc)
Dockerfile syntax is valid (no build errors from this change)

userStories.title: Add FreeBASIC to Dockerfile
userStories.description: As a developer, I want FreeBASIC installed in Docker so the BASIC Sudoku solver can run.
acceptanceCriteria: Create a new section for FreeBASIC in server/Dockerfile (after section 13 or in section 12)
Handle both architectures: aarch64 (ARM64) and x86_64
Download FreeBASIC from official releases (GitHub or sourceforge)
Extract to /usr/local and ensure fbc binary is in PATH
Use pattern similar to other manual installs (Julia, Dart, Zig)
Dockerfile syntax is valid (no build errors from this change)
